name: Array Game
statement: You are given an array $$$a$$$ of $$$n$$$ positive integers. In one operation, you must pick some $$$(i, j)$$$ such that $$$1\leq i < j\leq |a|$$$ and append $$$|a_i - a_j|$$$ to the end of the $$$a$$$ (i.e. increase $$$n$$$ by $$$1$$$ and set $$$a_n$$$ to $$$|a_i - a_j|$$$). Your task is to minimize and print the minimum value of $$$a$$$ after performing $$$k$$$ operations.
inputFormat: Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 1000$$$) — the number of test cases. The description of the test cases follows. The first line of each test case contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$k$$$ ($$$2\le n\le 2\cdot 10^3$$$, $$$1\le k\le 10^9$$$) — the length of the array and the number of operations you should perform. The second line of each test case contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$1\le a_i\le 10^{18}$$$) — the elements of the array $$$a$$$. It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n^2$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$4\cdot 10^6$$$.
outputFormat: For each test case, print a single integer — the smallest possible value of the minimum of array $$$a$$$ after performing $$$k$$$ operations.
